TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content:
When you think back to the time they pulled a frieghter in a higher orbit with a railgun in a book in the Sci-Fi series Expanse and then suddenly think: "But the text implies them firing down, telling to stop firing while above the settelment, but they should have fired retrograde to get into a higher orbit!" and then go on to think how to explain that to the person who wrote the text without using prograde marker and radial/anti-radial for the whole church service...

Edited March 26, 2016 by superstrijder15
oops, wrote one word double
...you're watching a KSP mod usage tutorial on Youtube and you start spamming the "." key because the narrator is taking too long to get to the point.

Too often, I find myself right dragging the mouse when watching KSP videos. For some reason I am frequently surprised when it doesn't work.

Edited March 25, 2016 by MalevolentNinja
When you embarrass yourself and desperately hit f9

When your Kerbin is littered with crashed aircraft parts.

Nik Kruger Sciences isn't very eco-friendly...
I'm trying to call Jeb, anyone got his number ?
If you tell your colleagues that Ike was a moon of Mars which it was gravity locked to...

You know you're playing a lot of KSP when...

You turn up late for lunch at your grandparents house and your family laugh and all acuse you of not putting your clocks forward in the night when, infact you were up til 5.30am on KSP building experimental rovers.....
You know you play a lot of KSP when you can´t recall what else you have done that day...

When you say to a friend who doesn't play KSP:

It's not rocket science, man! It's super-- Crap...
When you're in bored in class and begin to plan your next Jool probe. And when the teacher asks you a question, you say "I only need about 3000 m/s of DV to get into orbit!"

1 hour ago, Andem said:

When you say to a friend who doesn't play KSP:

It's not rocket science, man! It's super-- Crap...

C'mon, rocket science isn't that hard!

When you go to bed, close your eyes, and keep right on building that SSTO that didn't quite make orbit... 

Damn you, sir. You will fly.

6 minutes ago, eddiew said:

When you go to bed, close your eyes, and keep right on building that SSTO that didn't quite make orbit... 

Damn you, sir. You will fly.

That's where I get my best ideas!!!

JR
When overtaking cars on the highway I think to myself "burning to lower orbit, lower orbit achieved, relative velocity to target is now approx 2m/s."
It's getting light outside..I can hear birds...I need to get to duna....
When you think 2TB's of Hard Drive space won't be enough for the all the pics , videos and mods

I just watched the movie Capture The Flag with my nearly 4 year old granddaughter and I was taking notes from her about possible future designs........

Edited March 29, 2016 by maceemiller
When you try to use the olberth effect while running cause a turn is by a tree.

Just now, Rath said:

When you try to use the olberth effect while running cause a turn is by a tree.

I do that whenever there's a railing or something and I have a sharp turn

Just now, Puggonaut said:

When you think 2TB's of Hard Drive space won't be enough for the all the pics , videos and mods

 

Holy Cow, how many freakin mods/pics/videos do you have!?

18 hours ago, JT531 said:

When you're in bored in class and begin to plan your next Jool probe. And when the teacher asks you a question, you say "I only need about 3000 m/s of DV to get into orbit!"

Isn't it like 2240 m/s, or am I just assuming that's for super low LKO, and you're putting it in like a 100,000 m orbit?

#Spaceception , I dunno lol , I Have........

4 complete installs of the game in different folders ,

use fraps to record videos in HD so about 1gb for every 10 mins ,

70+ Mods ,

Plus god knows how many pictures
All desktop screen savers are KSP, and my biggest folder is "KSP", with around 400 screenshots and 50 mods for later availability (and also so I remember them)
Been designing craft in my sleep...need help.....s.o.s....

20 hours ago, Spaceception said:

Isn't it like 2240 m/s, or am I just assuming that's for super low LKO, and you're putting it in like a 100,000 m orbit?

JT531 is probably counting the flight from ground level, fighting gravity and aerodynamic drag.

I know I'm playing a lot of KSP when I feel it is my obligation to inform people of this sort of thing whether they ask for it or not.

When you right click every screen/video to get a better view on the scene ...

When you start calculating masses and deltaV of common objects around you .... 

When you cant take alien movies serious anymore because all you see are not green aliens, but kerbals...

Edited March 31, 2016 by theorigin
